page.title: 04Rivers, Wickhambreaux.
page.content: { The Great Stour}was dredged fifty years ago. At West Stourmouth a big pump sucks up water and pumps it to the{Great Stour.}There are five diggers operating on the river, but they can bring in more if needed. Alongside the{Great Stour}at{Stodmarsh are reed beds and by the{Little Stour is mainly farm land. The{Great Stour is about seventeen metres wide and the{Little Stour}is about seven metres wide. The{Great Stour}is tidal and slightly salty. The River Board maintain the river, cutting the weeds and banks twice a year. The{Lampen {Stream}runs through Stodmarsh. It is only about four miles long and one and a half metres wide. The{Great Stour}is navigable by quite big motor launches which can come up river from the sea.
